programme.title: L'infanzia rubata - I traumi del Terzo Reich
programme.desc: Tre testimoni raccontano la loro infanzia segnata dalla guerra: Günter, soldato bambino; Monika, con un padre disperso; Ruth, ebrea nascosta. Tutti uniti dal trauma causato dal Terzo Reich. A 70 anni dalla fine, le ferite restano visibili.

programme.title: Eva Braun
programme.desc: Solo dopo la sua morte Eva Braun entrò nell’occhio pubblico in Germania. Il 30 aprile 1945 si tolse la vita con Hitler nel bunker a Berlino, un giorno dopo averlo sposato. A lungo tenuta ai margini, visse tra Monaco e il Berghof. Una biografia recente prova a superare l’immagine della bionda passiva.

programme.title: Desert War - Fighting Rommel
programme.desc: Ancora oggi, Erwin Rommel è considerato un generale apolitico che, con idee geniali, portò gli inglesi sull’orlo della sconfitta in Nord Africa. Ma il suo mito è dovuto soprattutto alla propaganda nazista. Esperti militari analizzano gli eventi.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: Gli Anni del Dopoguerra in Germania
programme.desc: Berlino distrutta dopo la guerra. Giovani disorientati, criminalità (Gladow). Divisione Est/Ovest, mercato nero. Ricerca di un nuovo inizio.

programme.title: Il Terzo Reich a colori
programme.desc: Archivi privati rivelano inediti filmati a colori del Terzo Reich: Normandia, feste, atrocità della Wehrmacht e vita di Hitler, offrendo un'opprimente realtà del regime nazista.

programme.title: Il Cacciatore di Nazisti - Anton Freud e l'Operazione Haystack
programme.desc: Nell’inverno del 1945/46, un gruppo di uomini in jeep e Harley attraversa la Germania settentrionale a caccia di criminali nazisti. Si tratta di membri dell’Unità Investigativa sui Crimini di Guerra, nome in codice “Operazione haystack”, e tra loro c’è il maggiore Anton Walter Freud, il nipote di Sigmund Freud. Anton è rientrato in Germania appena finita la guerra e, come ufficiale dei servizi segreti britannici, sta cercando di rintracciare nella zona di occupazione britannica i nazisti ricercati: assassini in uniforme, brutali scagnozzi delle SS e medici spietati che conducevano esperimenti su bambini sotto gli ordini di Josef Mengele.

programme.title: La televisione sotto la svastica
programme.desc: Il documentario svela la nascita della televisione in Germania nazista, antecedente agli anni ’50 americani. Filmati inediti mostrano programmi, eventi e interviste dal Terzo Reich, rivelando una propaganda estetica e ideologica diversa da quella conosciuta, con immagini straordinarie.

programme.title: Il Terzo Reich a colori
programme.desc: Archivi privati rivelano inediti filmati a colori del Terzo Reich: Normandia, feste, atrocità della Wehrmacht e vita di Hitler, offrendo un'opprimente realtà del regime nazista.

programme.title: Il patto Hitler-Stalin
programme.desc: Il documentario esplora la partnership tra Germania nazista e URSS (1939), le loro sfere d'interesse e le conseguenze del patto Hitler-Stalin in Europa.

programme.title: Operazione Barbarossa
programme.desc: L'Operazione Barbarossa si arena a Mosca, ma Hitler rilancia l'offensiva nel 1942 verso il Caucaso e Stalingrado. La Wehrmacht, pur potente, affronta una resistenza sovietica più esperta e una logistica insostenibile. La battaglia di Stalingrado si rivela un disastro per i tedeschi, segnando una svolta psicologica e militare nella guerra.

programme.title: Morte nel Bunker - La vera storia della caduta di Hitler
programme.desc: Hitler, fisicamente e mentalmente instabile, si suicidò (cianuro e pistola). Magda Goebbels uccise i figli, forse con un medico.

programme.title: The Blitzkrieg Myth
programme.desc: Blitzkrieg: successi tedeschi iniziali, non pianificati, guidati dalla follia di Hitler.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: The Blitzkrieg Myth
programme.desc: Blitzkrieg: successi tedeschi iniziali, non pianificati, guidati dalla follia di Hitler.

programme.title: Operazione Barbarossa
programme.desc: L'Operazione Barbarossa si arena a Mosca, ma Hitler rilancia l'offensiva nel 1942 verso il Caucaso e Stalingrado. La Wehrmacht, pur potente, affronta una resistenza sovietica più esperta e una logistica insostenibile. La battaglia di Stalingrado si rivela un disastro per i tedeschi, segnando una svolta psicologica e militare nella guerra.

programme.title: 1945 - La guerra in prima linea in Germania
programme.desc: Quando le truppe americane iniziarono la loro invasione finale della Germania nazista a metà febbraio del 1945, i cineoperatori dell’esercito statunitense erano al loro fianco. Ripresero molte ore di straordinario materiale su pellicola da 35 mm. Più di mille rulli sono stati conservati negli archivi americani; molti di essi non sono stati toccati per decenni. Mostrano per la Seconda Guerra Mondiale ciò che abbiamo visto finora solo per le guerre in Vietnam e, più recentemente, in Iraq. Integrati nelle truppe, i cineoperatori documentarono numerose storie di vittoria e sconfitta, morte e liberazione. Volti di disperazione e gioia, scene di guerra e di pace, filmate con meticolosità da...

programme.title: Leni Riefenstahl - La fine di un mito
programme.desc: Leni Riefenstahl, regista di Hitler, divide ancora. Genio o propagandista? Il documentario svela il suo uso spregiudicato di collaboratori e la sua negazione dei crimini nazisti, rivelando una carriera controversa.

programme.title: Eva Braun
programme.desc: Solo dopo la sua morte Eva Braun entrò nell’occhio pubblico in Germania. Il 30 aprile 1945 si tolse la vita con Hitler nel bunker a Berlino, un giorno dopo averlo sposato. programme.title: Gli Anni del Dopoguerra in Germania
programme.desc: Berlino distrutta dopo la guerra. Giovani disorientati, criminalità (Gladow). Divisione Est/Ovest, mercato nero. Ricerca di un nuovo inizio.

programme.title: Operazione Barbarossa
programme.desc: L'Operazione Barbarossa (1941) fu l'invasione nazista dell'URSS, un'aggressione brutale. Nonostante i successi iniziali, la Wehrmacht sottovalutò la resistenza sovietica e l'immensità del territorio. Il conflitto, segnato da atrocità e ordini criminali, divenne una guerra di annientamento, fallendo nella conquista di Mosca.

programme.title: Hitler e la sua cerchia ristretta
programme.desc: Per decenni gli storici hanno sostenuto che Hitler non avesse vita privata e fosse un essere socialmente disturbato. In uno studio innovativo, Heike Görtemaker ha rivelato che aveva relazioni e amicizie. Il suo circolo ristretto era il suo rifugio, basato su lealtà assoluta fino alla fine nel 1945.

La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: Il Terzo Reich a colori
programme.desc: Archivi privati rivelano inediti filmati a colori del Terzo Reich: Normandia, feste, atrocità della Wehrmacht e vita di Hitler, offrendo un'opprimente realtà del regime nazista.

programme.title: La fine della guerra a Colori
programme.desc: Quando nel marzo 1945 le truppe USA conquistano la Germania nazista da ovest, vengono seguite da troupe che filmano il paese sconfitto e occupato. La particolarità: usano pellicola a colori 16mm. Il risultato è un documento unico, tra città distrutte, volti degli abitanti e orrori del regime.

programme.title: La televisione sotto la svastica
programme.desc: Il documentario svela la nascita della televisione in Germania nazista, antecedente agli anni ’50 americani. Filmati inediti mostrano programmi, eventi e interviste dal Terzo Reich, rivelando una propaganda estetica e ideologica diversa da quella conosciuta, con immagini straordinarie.

programme.title: Desert War - Fighting Rommel
programme.desc: Ancora oggi, Erwin Rommel è considerato un generale apolitico che, con idee geniali, portò gli inglesi sull’orlo della sconfitta in Nord Africa. Ma il suo mito è dovuto soprattutto alla propaganda nazista. Esperti militari analizzano gli eventi.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S01:E08 - Secret Trade
programme.desc: Ivan Carter investigates Africa's infamous poaching trade.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E01 - Operation Grizzly Bear
programme.desc: This week, wardens are tackling a situation involving a missing child that was reportedly pulled away by a bear... Luckily, it's just a training drill. At the same time, shed antler hunting season kicks off, keeping the wardens busy!

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E02 - Operation Water Rescue
programme.desc: In this episode, some wardens are handling early season fishermen about the gaming rules, and others are picking up skills for open water rescues.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E03 - Operation Paddlefish
programme.desc: Wardens come across a group after catching some antler poachers, clamp down on fishermen trying to cheat during paddlefish season, and one warden handles a lively bunch of partying campers.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E04 - Operation Justice
programme.desc: A five-year-old poaching case finally wraps up, and a grizzly bear has the wardens on high alert. Afterward, the wardens gather in Helena for their yearly meet-up and have a bit of fun.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E01 - At All Costs
programme.desc: Ivan goes on a journey to save his friend's nineteen rhinos from the poaching epidemic now sweeping through South Africa. The solution: a logistical nightmare of transporting the entire herd to a secure location 600 miles across the country.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E02 - The Heart of the Conflict
programme.desc: Investigating a string of murdered lions, Ivan gets to the very heart of an ancient conflict between humans and lions. The outcome will test Ivan's own core values about cultural

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E03 - One Rhino at a Time
programme.desc: While visiting a secret orphanage that cares for rescued baby rhinos, Ivan discovers the blood, sweat, tears that goes into saving this endangered species. An emergency phone call sends him on an adventure with a group of local heroes to save the next newly orphaned rhino.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E04 - Elephant Country
programme.desc: Ivan joins the foremost anti-poaching team in Mozambique to bring down one particular group of poachers who have been killing local elephants for their ivory.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E05 - Capturing the Wild
programme.desc: After seeing the disappearance of wildlife in northern Africa, Ivan joins an elite capture team to see how wildlife is captured, bought, and sold. This 'Wildlife Trade' is a ground breaking business model that could change the entire face of conservation in Africa.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E06 - On the Frontline
programme.desc: From rhino saviors and lion researchers, to savvy entrepreneurs and armed security teams, Ivan tours the front lines of conservation to meet the individuals who are reshaping and protecting wild Africa. What does it really mean to devote your life to the cause of conservation? Ivan journeys to four separate countries to find out what makes these unsung heroes tick.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E07 - Sold into Slavery
programme.desc: Ivan is investigating the illegal trade of bush meat in Kinshasa, when he stumbles upon three captive baby chimpanzees being sold on the black market. A dramatic rescue is planned that sees the chimps safely delivered to a place dedicated to providing a better future for all primates in Africa.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E08 - The Forgotten Giants
programme.desc: Not all poaching is for horns and tusks. In many parts of poverty-stricken Africa, giraffes are killed mercilessly for their meat. Ivan joins a specialized team in exploring radical solutions to both save the giraffe and provide food to communities in need.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E09 - Operation Check Point
programme.desc: Working to safeguard our cherished natural resources in some of the nation's most hidden areas means there's always something interesting happening at work.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E10 - Operation Crow Creek
programme.desc: Montana game wardens are riding through the backcountry looking for poachers, while other wardens are handling more illegal hunting and fishing activities, and trying to stop an old man from feeding deer.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E11 - Operation Whitefish
programme.desc: Wardens stumble upon a shocking crime scene with deer poachers and some illegal fishing going on. They also bid farewell to their colleague, Captain Jeff Darrah, who retires after 26 years of service.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E12 - Operation White Sulpher
programme.desc: Wardens are sorting through some hunters' conflicting tales, causing a guy to get in a bit of a jam. At the same time, other wardens are handling people trying to sneak onto properties as hunting season wraps up.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E13 - Operation Recap
programme.desc: We chat with Bryan Golie, Jeff Darrah, Joe Kambic, and John Lasofsky to hear their experiences as Montana Game Wardens. They share what they've gone through in their careers and talk about what happened this past season.

programme.title: Wardens - S04:E01 - Antler Raiders
programme.desc: Montana game wardens try to control the masses as the gates open and antler hunters are set free to find their trophies.

programme.title: Wardens - S04:E02 - Across The Seeded Fields
programme.desc: Montana game wardens are out on the first day of pronghorn season, keeping an eye on both lawful and unlawful hunting, and making sure seeded fields don't get damaged.

programme.title: Wardens - S04:E03 - Guts
programme.desc: Montana game wardens face the challenges and chaos that come with the first day of deer hunting season.

programme.title: Wardens - S04:E04 - Litica
programme.desc: Working to protect our treasured natural resources in some of the country's most secluded spots means there's never a boring day on the job.

programme.title: Wardens - S04:E05 - In The Drink
programme.desc: Montana game wardens handle a range of water-related problems such as littering, underage drinking, and the yearly Yellowstone Boat Float.

programme.title: Wardens - S04:E06 - Warrants and Weed
programme.desc: Game wardens often have to handle people who keep breaking the rules or have unresolved warrants, which can complicate things when they're approached.

programme.title: Carter's W.A.R. - S02:E01 - At All Costs
programme.desc: Ivan goes on a journey to save his friend's nineteen rhinos from the poaching epidemic now sweeping through South Africa. The solution: a logistical nightmare of transporting the entire herd to a secure location 600 miles across the country.

programme.title: Wardens - S03:E13 - Operation Recap
programme.desc: We chat with Bryan Golie, Jeff Darrah, Joe Kambic, and John Lasofsky to hear their experiences as Montana Game Wardens. They share what they've gone through in their careers and talk about what happened this past season.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E01 - Best Moments Part 1
programme.desc: Brothers Chris and Casey Keefer look back on some of the best moments from the first two seasons of Dropped. They discuss their most unforgettable solo hunts and how the show has changed over time.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E02 - Best Moments Part 2
programme.desc: Brothers Chris and Casey Keefer look back on some of the best moments from the first two seasons of Dropped. They chat about behind-the-scenes stuff no one has seen and give a sneak peek into what's coming up in Season 3.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E03 - Dropped And Dragging
programme.desc: Chris and Casey Keefer, two brothers, set off on another adventure in the wilds of Alaska. They're exploring a river system that hasn't been hunted in over ten years because of predators. The journey begins slowly, with the brothers spending more time dragging their gear than floating, in a place teeming with grizzlies.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E04 - Death In The Water
programme.desc: The search for a mature moose begins as brothers Chris and Casey Keefer move their way downriver, but when they cross paths with a giant sow grizzly, they get way more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E05 - Rising Waters
programme.desc: Chris and Casey Keefer keep heading downriver, and as the moose rut draws nearer, they have to rely more on catching fish, hunting ducks, and gathering berries. A massive Alaskan rainstorm hits, bringing big challenges for their success.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E01 - Into the High Lonesome
programme.desc: Laramy Sasquatch Miller sets off on The Trail with his trusty horse 7, to test his survival skills and pay homage to mountain men of the past. Saying goodbye to his family, Laramy and 7 have to battle the elements, build shelter, live off of the land, and survive a 30-day trek through the backcountry.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E02 - Camp Otis
programme.desc: Modern-day mountain man Laramy Miller sets out on the trail to experience life in the high lonesome.

programme.title: The Trail- S01:E03 - Relocation
programme.desc: Laramy realizes that game is scarce because of the wolves and he decides to put some distance between himself and the pack. Time to break down camp and move to a new location.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E04 - White Death
programme.desc: Snow, what the mountain men called white death, stops Laramy in his tracks. In addition, his trusty horse 7 has suffered a leg injury. Laramy must take care of Seven, battle through hunger, and survive the snowfall.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E05 - The Struggle
programme.desc: Laramy remains stuck at Camp Hell Hole, nursing 7's leg, and struggling to survive in the freezing temperatures without food.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E07 - The Journal
programme.desc: Pastor Mike Turner is on a solo hike across the continental divide in the unforgiving Wind Rivers Range of Wyoming when he becomes hopelessly trapped under a boulder. He chronicles his grueling 11-day fight to survive in his own journal.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E08 - Tree Stand Fall
programme.desc: Deer hunter Nathan Holcomb plummets from his tree stand. Every hunters' worst nightmare becomes Nathan's reality. With a broken back and paralyzed, Nathan must crawl out on his own to find help.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E07 - The Journal
programme.desc: In what is regarded as one of greatest survival stories of the 20th Century, sailor Steven Callahan finds himself alone and adrift in a life raft after his boat, the Napoleon Solo sinks in the mid Atlantic.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E10 - Adrift Part 2
programme.desc: Facing starvation, dehydration and predators from the deep, sailor Steven Callahan fights to survive not only the physical hardships, but also the mental and emotional strain of being adrift and alone in a disintegrating life raft.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S03:E01 - Nightmare Canyon Part 1
programme.desc: Justin and Jeremy Harris' weekend decent into a remote Utah canyon becomes a survival nightmare when Justin severely breaks his leg. As night fast approaches and temperatures drop below freezing, how will these two brothers survive?

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E01 - Best Moments Part 1
programme.desc: Brothers Chris and Casey Keefer look back on some of the best moments from the first two seasons of Dropped. They discuss their most unforgettable solo hunts and how the show has changed over time.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E02 - Best Moments Part 2
programme.desc: Brothers Chris and Casey Keefer look back on some of the best moments from the first two seasons of Dropped. They chat about behind-the-scenes stuff no one has seen and give a sneak peek into what's coming up in Season 3.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E03 - Dropped And Dragging
programme.desc: Chris and Casey Keefer, two brothers, set off on another adventure in the wilds of Alaska. They're exploring a river system that hasn't been hunted in over ten years because of predators. The journey begins slowly, with the brothers spending more time dragging their gear than floating, in a place teeming with grizzlies.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E04 - Death In The Water
programme.desc: The search for a mature moose begins as brothers Chris and Casey Keefer move their way downriver, but when they cross paths with a giant sow grizzly, they get way more than they bargained for.

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E05 - Rising Waters
programme.desc: Chris and Casey Keefer keep heading downriver, and as the moose rut draws nearer, they have to rely more on catching fish, hunting ducks, and gathering berries. A massive Alaskan rainstorm hits, bringing big challenges for their success.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E01 - Into the High Lonesome
programme.desc: Laramy Sasquatch Miller sets off on The Trail with his trusty horse 7, to test his survival skills and pay homage to mountain men of the past. Saying goodbye to his family, Laramy and 7 have to battle the elements, build shelter, live off of the land, and survive a 30-day trek through the backcountry.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E02 - Camp Otis
programme.desc: Modern-day mountain man Laramy Miller sets out on the trail to experience life in the high lonesome.

programme.title: The Trail- S01:E03 - Relocation
programme.desc: Laramy realizes that game is scarce because of the wolves and he decides to put some distance between himself and the pack. Time to break down camp and move to a new location.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E04 - White Death
programme.desc: Snow, what the mountain men called white death, stops Laramy in his tracks. In addition, his trusty horse 7 has suffered a leg injury. Laramy must take care of Seven, battle through hunger, and survive the snowfall.

programme.title: The Trail - S01:E05 - The Struggle
programme.desc: Laramy remains stuck at Camp Hell Hole, nursing 7's leg, and struggling to survive in the freezing temperatures without food.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E07 - The Journal
programme.desc: Pastor Mike Turner is on a solo hike across the continental divide in the unforgiving Wind Rivers Range of Wyoming when he becomes hopelessly trapped under a boulder. He chronicles his grueling 11-day fight to survive in his own journal.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E08 - Tree Stand Fall
programme.desc: Deer hunter Nathan Holcomb plummets from his tree stand. Every hunters' worst nightmare becomes Nathan's reality. With a broken back and paralyzed, Nathan must crawl out on his own to find help.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E07 - The Journal
programme.desc: In what is regarded as one of greatest survival stories of the 20th Century, sailor Steven Callahan finds himself alone and adrift in a life raft after his boat, the Napoleon Solo sinks in the mid Atlantic.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S02:E10 - Adrift Part 2
programme.desc: Facing starvation, dehydration and predators from the deep, sailor Steven Callahan fights to survive not only the physical hardships, but also the mental and emotional strain of being adrift and alone in a disintegrating life raft.

programme.title: Fight to Survive - S03:E01 - Nightmare Canyon Part 1
programme.desc: Justin and Jeremy Harris' weekend decent into a remote Utah canyon becomes a survival nightmare when Justin severely breaks his leg. As night fast approaches and temperatures drop below freezing, how will these two brothers survive?

programme.title: Dropped - S03:E01 - Best Moments Part 1
programme.desc: Brothers Chris and Casey Keefer look back on some of the best moments from the first two seasons of Dropped. They discuss their most unforgettable solo hunts and how the show has changed over time.

programme.title: Alaska's Ultimate Bush Pilots

programme.title: Fight to Survive
programme.desc: After a successful hunt., Adrian Knopps' hunting partner disappears taking their bear out to the boat. Now Adrian finds himself stranded on a tidal flat surround by bears and wolf packs and with massive storm bearing down on him. How will he survive?

programme.title: Fight to Survive
programme.desc: A bass fishing trip goes horribly wrong when a bolt of lightning strikes their boat, leaving Seventeen-year-old Christian Neal burned and unconscious and his father Gabe blown into the water and paralyzed. It will take a miracle to save them.

programme.title: Viral Wild
programme.desc: Grace and poise is personified in the largest animals on the planet.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: A white monster charges up the Eastern Seaboard, and 80 million citizens are in its path.

programme.title: Storm Hunters
programme.desc: Doubt and disbelief plague the Stormhunters after an exhaustive chase through Tornado Alley. The team is forced to make an uncomfortable decision. Do they play it safe or push past their fear?

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Filming the volcanoes, mudpools and geysers in the geothermic wonderland of New Zealand’s north island, we learn that a new island is being created by an undersea volcano 1000 miles north in Tonga. Determined to be among the first to see this “newest land on earth”, we head for the remote island by plane and boat, after various nautical mishaps, George ends up, bedraggled and clad in nothing but underwear and a lifejacket, honored to be one of the very first to explore this brand new island.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: In 2000, a remarkable find was made in Chihuahua, Mexico, of a spectacular cave filled with giant crystals, some over 20 meters long. But it is a intensely difficult spot to explore – with temperatures over 50 degrees C and humidity well over 100%. George leads an Explorers Club Flag Expedition into the cave, wearing special refrigerated suits and respirators to battle the extreme environment.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We break the bounds of earth, and look at the environment of space. We examine the difficulties and challenges of exploring this most challenging environment.↵ ↵George experiences some of the extreme training needed for space travel –aboard a Czech-built Albatross fighter jet, the Zero-G plane, and a centrifuge producing 6 G’s of force, and witnesses the launch of a flight to the International Space Station.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George links up with two experienced polar adventurers to explore the frigid Canadian arctic in the depths of winter. The team first uses skis to cross the fractured sea ice of Frobisher Bay, then dog teams to head north through the spectacular Auyuittuq Mountains.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The “Angry Planet” team hopes to film the natural wonders and extreme phenomena of this fascinating Central Asian country, including a spectacularly burning crater of natural gas, underground lakes, sandstorms and remnants of the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George's exploration of the undersea world begins on a submarine in Grand Caymon.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George and three side-kicks head straight into the “Bearcage”, looking to get beat up by the biggest, baddest hailstones that Texas and Oklahoma can throw at them. They find it – and their stormchasing vehicles don’t look too pretty after coming through these massive storms.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The “Angry Planet” team will be tracking storms through the 2009 Hurricane season, and plan to film george as he heads into a big one.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: Josh Morgerman chased 3 typhoons in 6 days, a personal record amidst the Western Pacific's destructive forces.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In 2015, Josh Morgerman traveled to Mexico to chase what would become one of the strongest tropical hurricanes ever recorded. His harrowing experience with Patricia would forever shape his identity as a Hurricane Chaser.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: One hurricane, 2 countries, 2,000 miles. Josh chases Hurricane Fiona from the Dominican Republic to Canada.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In this episode, we recount three of Josh Morgerman's most intense chases throughout the country of Taiwan, and witness his years of experience aid him in avoiding catastrophe a world away.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In 2014, Josh went face to face with one of the most violent hurricanes ever to strike Cabo San Lucas.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: Durimg Super Typhoon Haiyan, Josh Morgerman found himself rescuing locals from its aftermath.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: Josh Morgerman traveled to Texas to be an eye-witness to Hurricane Harvey.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In 2014, Josh went face to face with one of the most violent hurricanes ever to strike Cabo San Lucas.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: Josh relives his most harrowing moments hunting the world’s most dangerous storms.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In a 1-year span, Hurricanes Laura and Ida hit one of the most hurricane prone regions of the United States.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In this episode, we recount some of Josh Morgerman's greatest chases throughout the country of Mexico, which over the years became his favorite storm hunting grounds.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In 2022, Josh chased the deadliest hurricane to strike Florida since 1935: Category 4 Ian.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: Josh Morgerman chased 3 typhoons in 6 days, a personal record amidst the Western Pacific's destructive forces.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: Josh Morgerman chases devastating Hurricane Maria.

programme.title: Mission: Hurricane
programme.desc: In 2019, Josh Morgerman chased Hurricane Dorian in the Bahamas in what wound up becoming one of the most intense and dangerous storms he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Extreme Weather Countdown
programme.desc: Things heat up with sweltering heat waves, then cool down with icy blizzards on Extreme Weather Countdown!

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2007, Brian e Beverly Mauck furono trovati morti nella loro casa a Graham, Washington. Con un'impronta palmare insanguinata e impronte di scarpe, gli inquirenti si focalizzarono su Daniel Tavares, che in passato aveva tatuato la schiena a Brian.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Un padre e marito del West Virginia di 33 anni apparentemente muore in un incendio accidentale, ma uno sguardo più attento alla scena rivela qualcosa di più sinistro.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Un incendio in casa uccide l'unico medico in città. Un'indagine sugli incendi dolosi suggerisce che sia stato il figlio dell'infermiera del medico.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A popular handyman in a New Hampshire town is found murdered and investigators follow forensic clues to a shocking conclusion.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Quando una donna di 79 anni viene trovata uccisa a casa sua, gli investigatori sospettano inizialmente il marito o un vicino violento. I bossoli dei proiettili ritrovati sulla scena e un database high-tech rivelano l'improbabile assassino.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Un ex detenuto del Texas è condannato per un omicidio che sostiene di non aver commesso. Da dietro le sbarre, è deciso a usare la scienza forense per dimostrare la sua innocenza.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: In California, il DNA di un uomo innocente viene trovato sulla scena di una fatale irruzione in casa.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Otto giorni dalla scomparsa, il corpo seminudo di una diciottenne viene trovato galleggiare in un fiume.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Quando una studentessa di Yale sparisce misteriosamente alcuni giorni prima del suo matrimonio, gli investigatori perlustrano un laboratorio di ricerca alla ricerca di prove.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Mentre in città le voci si diffondono su chi ha ucciso l'assistente di un insegnante, l'assassino si ne va.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 1995, la cameriera di Palm Beach Denise O'Neill venne rapita e uccisa. Il suo vicino Luis Caballero destò sospetti per il suo strano comportamento nei confronti delle troupe televisive che riprendevano il crimine.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Dopo che il sospetto fu accusato di incendio doloso e delitto, sostenne la sua innocenza ma fu condannato a 25 anni di galera. Ricorse a testi legali nella biblioteca del carcere e a programmi di scienza forense e decise di provare la sua innocenza.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Negli anni '90, i media soprannominarono Richard Rogers il "Killer dell'Ultima Chiamata" perché prendeva di mira nei locali gay uomini che erano evidentemente ubriachi.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Quando il cancelliere Peter Porco non si presenta al lavoro nel novembre 2004, un funzionario del tribunale è richiesto a casa della famiglia Porco a Bethlehem, New York.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Il 12 maggio 1994, Crystal Perry fu brutalmente assassinata nella sua casa a Bridgton, nel Maine. Michael Hutchinson, 32 anni, fu dichiarato colpevole di omicidio.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Uno stupratore seriale era a piede libero in una città in Texas. Nessuno sapeva dove avrebbe colpito ancora.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una ragazza di 13 anni scomparve dalla sua casa in Colorado e l'unica prova che il rapitore aveva lasciato erano tre impronte digitali su una zanzariera.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2006, Darlene VanderGiesen ricevette e-mail minacciose e poi scomparve. Il monitoraggio della fonte delle e-mail portò la polizia a casa di Daphne Wright, dove credono sia stato commesso un omicidio.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Nel 2003, Jason MacLennan tornò a casa e trovò il corpo di suo padre Ken disteso in una pozza di sangue.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Fifteen years later, DNA technology leads to justice for a murdered woman and her savagely beaten 4-year-old daughter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: La polizia di Seattle non aveva sospetti per il brutale delitto della cantante post-grunge Mia Zapata. Passò più di un decennio prima che gli scienziati forensi potessero usare le prove raccolte da un sagace patologo per identificare l'assassino.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una bambina di sei anni è scappata e si è nascosta quando ha visto sua nonna picchiata a morte, ma l'uomo l'ha seguita, picchiata e aggredita. Ha detto che l'aggressore era suo zio, che è stato condannato. Anni dopo ha ritrattato la testimonianza.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Una ragazza viene trovata morta nel suo appartamento. Con poche prove sulla scena, il caso rimane irrisolto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: La donna sul retro del camion agitava le braccia e urlava. Pensavano stesse facendo qualcosa di pericoloso per il gusto di farlo. Ma quando trovarono una giacca vicino a una pozza di sangue, capirono che ciò che avevano visto non era una scorribanda.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Il corpo di una giovane attraente fu trovato a un miglio dalla sua auto abbandonata. La polizia si allarmò particolarmente quando si rese conto che la vittima era venuta da loro per aiuto solo due settimane prima dopo un evento di rabbia al volante.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A seguito della morte improvvisa di una donna attenta alla salute, iniziano le indagini sulle possibili cause.

programme.desc: Le analisi del telefono cellulare aiutano a risolvere un omicidio in una comunità esclusiva.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Un serial killer è in fuga da vent'anni. Quando viene arrestato, la polizia fa una scoperta inaspettata.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: A seguito di un incendio, gli investigatori devono riesaminare una morte insolita, il che significa riesumare la vittima che era stata sepolta anni fa.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: I medici non riescono a capire perché una donna della California continua a ammalarsi. Quando muore, gli investigatori scoprono che qualcuno aveva mentito.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Un triangolo amoroso diventato fatale sembra chiuso fino a quando la tecnologia non ne racconta la storia.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Gli ultimi istanti della vittima sono su nastro. Sembra trattarsi di una rapina-omicidio. I messaggi sul telefono in un primo momento suggeriscono un amante deluso, ma la polizia trova un secondo sospettato animato dal desiderio di vendetta.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: Un ex detenuto del Texas è condannato per un omicidio che sostiene di non aver commesso. Da dietro le sbarre, è deciso a usare la scienza forense per dimostrare la sua innocenza.

programme.title: Forensic Files II
programme.desc: I pazienti dell'ospedale di Clarksburg, West Virginia, continuano a morire con bassi livelli di glicemia.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: La vittima era benvoluta e di successo, il che rendeva ancora più difficile da capire la crudeltà del crimine.

programme.desc: La donna venne violentata, pugnalata più volte e lasciata morire. Quando qualcuno che coincideva con la descrizione si è praticamente costituito, la polizia era sicura di avere il suo uomo... finché le prove del DNA non hanno dimostrato il contrario.

programme.desc: Una giovane donna frequenta le funzioni religiose serali... poi scompare. Quando la sua auto abbandonata viene ritrovata, il serbatoio è vuoto e manca una tanica di benzina che teneva nel bagagliaio per le emergenze.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S5 E8
programme.desc: E’ il giorno della finale a Hell’s Kitchen. I cuochi si svegliano e trovano sul tavolo una sorpresa: ci sono 4 buste per loro.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E1
programme.desc: I concorrenti alloggiano nel loft di Hell's Kitchen e hanno una notte intera per studiare il menu che serviranno la sera successiva. Durante la notte i concorrenti vengono svegliati continuamente da una sirena e su un televisore assistono alle lezioni di cucina dello Chef Cracco. Alle 8:00 i concorrenti scendono nelle cucine e Cracco mostra loro come tagliare la carne per fare il filetto alla Rossini.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E2
programme.desc: Il servizio non va bene e Cracco è costretto a chiudere anticipatamente prima la cucina blu e poi la cucina rossa. I concorrenti vengono mandati nel loft e hanno 30 minuti di tempo per decidere i loro nominati per l'eliminazione. La squadra rossa nomina Lorena e Amelia, la squadra blu Andrea e Gene.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E3
programme.desc: Le due squadre si affrontano in una sfida diretta sull'assaggio: i due concorrenti, bendati e dotati di cuffie, devono individuare quattro diversi alimenti solo assaggiandoli; vince la squadra che indovina il maggior numero di alimenti. La prova termina in parità, quindi vi è uno spareggio fra i concorrenti più forti delle due squadre (Lorenza e Gianluca) che determina la vittoria dei rossi. Per punizione, la squadra blu deve pulire 90 kg di pesce per il servizio, mentre la squadra rossa si gode alcune ore in un centro benessere.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E4
programme.desc: Le due squadre affrontano una prova in esterna che ha luogo in una fattoria: i concorrenti devono condurre nelle stalle alcuni animali, ad ognuno dei quali corrisponde un ingrediente; alla fine le due squadre devono preparare un piatto con gli ingredienti conquistati e Cracco determina la squadra vincitrice. I blu propongono dei ravioli di zucca con pancetta, i rossi propongono un filetto di cervo; la squadra rossa vince la sfida e come ricompensa ottiene una serata alla Terrazza Trussardi di Milano in compagnia dello chef Cracco.

programme.title: 12 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Il boot camp culinario di Gordon Ramsay negli USA mette alla prova nuovi aspiranti chef.

programme.title: 11 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Gli chef devono creare dei pasti per un Bar Mitzvah.

programme.title: 10 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Gli chef hanno 20 minuti per preparare delle tapas usando gli avanzi del precedente servizio.

programme.title: 9 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Il team affronta una prova del palato per identificare cibi diversi solo con l'assaggio.

programme.title: 7 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: La squadra prepara un piatto speciale a base di granchio reale.

programme.title: 6 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Ogni chef prepara un piatto usando 14 ingredienti specifici.

programme.title: 5 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: I concorrenti fanno una gita al Borgata Hotel e Casino.

programme.title: 4 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Per aumentare la motivazione, Ramsay dà agli chef un set di pentole in acciaio inossidabile.

programme.title: 3 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Gli chef preparano dei piatti per cento ospiti misteriosi.

programme.title: 2 Chefs Competono: Parte 1
programme.desc: I due concorrenti rimasti volano ancora una volta al Borgata di Atlantic City.

programme.title: 2 Chefs Competono: Parte 2
programme.desc: Il vincitore della quinta stagione di Hell's Kitchen viene annunciato.

programme.title: 16 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: 17 chef competono per una posto di primo chef a Whistler, Canada.

programme.title: 15 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: La sfida di oggi sta nel preparare un piatto perfetto di gamberi per il servizio della sera dopo.

programme.title: 14 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Ce la faranno i team a servire un pasto di prima mattina per un gruppo di duri vigili del fuoco?

programme.title: 13 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Il primo compito dei concorrenti è di preparare delle salsicce prima del servizio serale.

programme.title: 12 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: I cuochi devono preparare un pasto per un Marine di ritorno dall'Iraq.

programme.title: 11 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: I team devono creare un pasto di tre portate con meno di 700 calorie.

programme.title: 10 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: I gruppi hanno una sfida alfabetica per vincere un viaggio a Las Vegas.

programme.title: 9 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: I team sono sottoposti a un assaggio alla cieca per vincere un pasto in un ristorante di Santa Monica.

programme.title: 8 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: Questo episodio è caratterizzato da un tema francese, nella sfida e nel servizio serale.

programme.title: 7 Chefs Competono
programme.desc: La sfida per i team è creare tre piatti utilizzando ingredienti canadesi.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E5
programme.desc: Le due squadre sono protagoniste di un'asta nella quale sono in palio alcuni ingredienti; per aggiudicarsi gli alimenti, ogni team ha a disposizione un budget di 4000 hells, una valuta fittizia con su stampata l'effigie di Cracco. Al termine dell'asta, lo chef Cracco annuncia che con gli ingredienti comprati bisogna preparare tre piatti vegetariani in quarantacinque minuti; per la valutazione, le due squadre nominano un portavoce (Gianluca per i blu e Lorenza per i rossi) che ha il compito di presentare allo chef i tre piatti in ordine crescente dal meno riuscito al più riuscito. La sfida viene vinta dalla squadra rossa, che ottiene come ricompensa una lezione dello chef sulla...

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E6
programme.desc: Per la prova in esterna, le squadre vengono condotti in un bosco all'interno del quale sono nascosti alcuni ingredienti. Seguendo due percorsi stabiliti, i concorrenti devono raccogliere tutti gli ingredienti che riescono a trovare e poi utilizzarli per preparare un piatto di carne alla griglia. La squadra vincitrice ha come ricompensa un pomeriggio in un centro benessere e inoltre ha diritto all'ingresso di un nuovo membro: Tommaso per i blu ed Erica per i rossi. La prova viene vinta dai blu e Tommaso entra ufficialmente a far parte di Hell's Kitchen.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E7
programme.desc: Lo chef Cracco comunica alle squadre che il ristorante aprirà eccezionalmente anche a pranzo e la prova sarà proprio gestire il servizio. I clienti sono un gruppo di bambini e il menu è fatto apposta per loro (pasta al pomodoro, hamburger e patatine fritte, profiteroles) e la squadra vincitrice sarà quella che riuscirà a concludere per prima il servizio. Nonostante un iniziale vantaggio dei blu, la squadra rossa si aggiudica la vittoria e viene ricompensata con un pomeriggio all'interno di un parco acquatico, mentre i perdenti sono costretti a ripulire la sala e le cucine.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E8
programme.desc: Le due squadre ottengono dallo chef Cracco il potere di creare un proprio menu da proporre ai clienti con gli ingredienti presenti in dispensa. Nel frattempo però le squadre si affrontano in esterna: all'interno di un grande ipermercato ogni concorrente deve scegliere casualmente due bandierine che raffigurano gli stemmi delle varie regioni italiane; ad ogni bandierina sono associati degli ingredienti tipici della regione, che devono essere usati per ideare un piatto che racchiuda elementi di entrambe le regioni. Lo chef passa quindi a decidere quali siano le quattro idee migliori e sceglie Sybil e Laura per i rossi e Gene e Matteo per i blu. I quattro cuochi preparano i piatti nelle...

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen Italia S1 E9
programme.desc: Essendoci una situazione di sbilanciamento numerico degli elementi all'interno delle due squadre, Cracco dà ai rossi il compito di nominare una persona che passerà nei blu. Sybil si propone per lo scambio, per via delle divergenze caratteriali con Carmelo e quindi diviene un elemento della squadra blu. Per la prima sfida, i due team si scontrano in una prova di velocità: un concorrente per ogni squadra si deve lanciare in una vasca piena di ghiaccio e cercare un'etichetta con il nome di un ingrediente; il più veloce si aggiudica l'ingrediente scelto e può imporre allo sfidante sconfitto un ingrediente ostico fra quelli proposti da Cracco. Alla fine i concorrenti devono utilizzare...

programme.desc: La sfida per i concorrenti rimasti sta nel preparare piatti cinesi, indiani e messicani.

programme.title: Max sfida alle calorie S1
programme.desc: Hummus di ceci e uovo riso e verdure - Grassi, carboidrati e proteine devono essere sempre equilibrati in un pasto. Max pensa ad un piatto unico che contenga tutti gli ingredienti.

programme.title: Giorgione a casa tua
programme.desc: Assisi - Giorgione nel cuore dell'Umbria, Assisi, a casa dei suoi fans per cucinare insieme ricette tradizionali si', ma con il suo tocco laido e corrotto.

programme.title: Vito con i suoi S6
programme.desc: Gnocchi di zucca e bichetchup- Una zucca fenomenale è stata regalata da un amico a Roberto da il via una gara sulle possibili ricette da realizzare. Vince Roberto con gli gnocchi.

programme.title: Un viaggio in un calice
programme.desc: Il viaggio di Giuseppe Carrus nel Monferrato alla scoperta dei vini e dei viticoltori piemontesi

programme.title: Valtenesi tra terra e lago
programme.desc: Marco Sabellico assaggia i vini della Valtenesi, terra del Groppello e di grandi rosati.

programme.title: Questa terra e' la mia terra
programme.desc: S.4 - Peppe Guida in questa stagione esplora il mondo della cucina regionale. Autodidatta e cultore delle materie prime, è capace di coniugare l'altissima cucina con la semplicità.

programme.title: Petra
programme.desc: Una farina per ogni ricetta. Molte sono le farine esistenti e ognuna ha il proprio specifico uso in cucina. Scopriamolo con Petra e l'Unversità della farina

programme.title: Come è profondo il mare Capri e Ischia
programme.desc: Ischia ep3 - Lacco Ameno, un paese dedito alla pesca, qui Gianfranco incontra Domenico, pescatore da generazioni, che gli offre del pescato per le sue ricette. Ma Ischia è anche artigianato e Gianfranco scopre le sue meravigliose ceramiche.

programme.title: Il gusto di Igles
programme.desc: S11 - La cucina circolare di Igles Corelli è una cucina zero sprechi. Ricette e consigli pratici per una sfruttare al massimo e senza sprechi gli ingredienti.

programme.title: Beker on tour
programme.desc: Casoni di Marano Lagunare - Fabrizio Nonis incontra Truffelman per una grigliata tra aromi intensi e abbinamenti sorprendenti

programme.title: La cucina delle ragazze
programme.desc: S.6 - Sara e Laura sono grandi amiche e condividono una forte passione: la cucina. Laura, marchigiana, e Sara, romana, propongono le ricette più gustose delle rispettive regioni.

programme.title: Mangiio tutto tranne Portogallo
programme.desc: Sesimbra e non solo - Giovanni Angelucci, gastronomo viaggiatore, questa volta in Portogallo. Un reportage di gusto e cultura in compagnia di questo coloratissimo paese

programme.title: Parola di chef
programme.desc: Il punto di vista di un giovane talento della ristorazione italiana che si racconta svelando le proprie soddisfazioni, difficoltà, aspirazioni, in un percorso tra pubblico e privato.

programme.title: I panini li fa Max
programme.desc: I panini di Max Mariola, appetitosi, fantasiosi, gustosi, per una pausa golosa, una cena veloce o per una serata in compagnia.

programme.title: Giorgione orto e cucina Sardegna
programme.desc: Cozze - Pomodori - La Sardegna, terra di mare e non solo. Giorgione scopre i sapori di questa isola e con i suoi prodotti realizza ricette originali.

programme.title: Parola di chef

programme.title: Max sfida alle calorie S1

programme.title: Questa terra e' la mia terra

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: The perfect steak is a beautiful thing. Chef Ned Bell works with various cuts of beef and demonstrates the techniques used to create mouth-watering carnivorous dishes.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Herbs and spice and everything nice, that's what a great meal is made of. Chef Elizabeth Manville intoxicates us with the fragrance of fresh herbs and spices in a broad range of dishes.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: It's no tale - Fish is an incredibly versatile ingredient to cook with. Chef Michael Allemeier gives us tips on all the fishy business one needs to know.

programme.title: The Edible Road Show
programme.desc: Carlo takes us to the vineyards of the Niagara Peninsula in Southern Ontario to decork, debunk and demystify the simple pleasures of a glass of wine. We also do some wine cooking with celebreated chef Michael Olson and learn a sure fire never fail wine sauce.

programme.title: The Edible Road Show
programme.desc: Carlo goes to Whistler, British Columbia and takes part in a culinary grand prix. We also visit a very special green house 3 hours north of the Arctic Circle.

programme.title: The Edible Road Show
programme.desc: Carlo visits the annual Ottawa Food & Wine festival to find out what really is "Canadian Cuisine". We also go to New Brunswick for some old fashioned Acadian cooking as made 300 years ago, and then to Richmond British Columbia for a cranberry harvest with a twist in the beautiful Okanagan valley.

programme.title: Global Street Eats
programme.desc: Chef Dev prepares some of his favorite street food dishes that are easy to eat on the go, including Peruvian Ceviche, Tteokbokki from South Korea, and Manakish Flatbreads from Lebanon.

programme.title: Global Street Eats
programme.desc: Chef Dev shows off street food recipes that use less common cuts of meat, including Fish Head Curry from Singapore, Pork and Pâté Banh Mi from Vietnam, and Jamaican Jerk Oxtail.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Italian chef and foodie Vanessa Gianfrancesco shows us how to make dishes delicious enough for a fine restaurant with fried zucchini blossoms, spaghetti carbonara, roast lamb, and fruit crostata.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef and culinary instructor Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen shows us Japanese cuisine inspired by other cultures with a pork and tofu dish, sesame chicken salad, breaded pork cutlet, and even a French crepe.

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by China, Canada, Peru, and Mexico!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by the USA, Canada, Mexico, and Suriname!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by Scotland, France, the USA, and Myanmar!

programme.title: Global Veggies
programme.desc: Chef Pino Di Cerbo creates veggie dishes inspired by Turkey, Honduras, China, and Nigeria!

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Here's a tongue twister: Theresa, tuna, tangerine! In this episode, host Theresa Visintin picks her favourite letter, "T," and introduces us to scrumptious recipes using tuna and tangerine. Theresa loves tuna and Italian cuisine, so naturally she combines both to create a mouth-watering pasta with some savoury tomato, olive, and tuna sauce. Next, Theresa satisfies her sweet tooth with a decadent tangerine parfait! Using the sweet juice of the tangerine, Theresa creates gelatin, with a hint of orange liqueur. She tops it all off by whipping up a fluffy cream to complete this sweet treat. Then it's time for a real challenge: tuna and tangerine in one recipe!

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: In this "H" challenge, Chef Lauren Gulyas decides to take on the unique flavours of halibut and horseradish. She starts with a perfectly prepared prosciutto wrapped halibut, pairing the buttery flavour of the fish with the saltiness of the cured meat. Throw in some dill potatoes and you've got a beautifully balanced dish. Next up, Chef Lauren show us how to make a delightful roast beef dip with a zesty horseradish sauce using carrots, vinegar, mayo and a little lemon. Finally, she is challenged to make a dish that combines both ingredients, and does she ever deliver!

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: In this letter "P" challenge, Chef Robert Jewell showcases his vegetarian skills using pecans and peppers. Despite his cowboy roots, Robert shows us he can kick it with vegetarians by cooking up a juicy meatless "meatloaf" using pecans. But, no "meatloaf" would be complete without a gravy! Robert fries up earthy portobello mushrooms before adding a special ingredient to thicken the gravy, you guessed it -- pecans! Now, on to peppers. Robert doubles up, using both the vegetable and seasoning, to make a delicious red pepper coulis with herb and pepper crusted beef tenderloin. Robert goes a little nuts when he prepares his final recipe using both pecans and peppers.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Cheese or chocolate? Why not both! In this "C" challenge, host Theresa Visintin takes on both decadent ingredients. But first, she shows us that being cheesy is easy, especially when you stuff chicken breast with creamy goat's cheese and finely diced apples. Theresa takes the flavour one step further by coating the stuffed chicken with sage, parmesan, and panko bread crumbs, then frying it to a crispy golden brown. Next, Theresa whips up a dessert fan favourite, the decadent and oh-so-irresistible dark chocolate lava cake. Finally, Theresa has an irresistible recipe using ooey gooey cheese and warm chocolate.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Adopted Tara Broadbent is shocked by the results of her DNA test and learns more about her biological ancestry through food.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Martina Castillo learns more about her heritage with the help of Host Tyrone Edwards and expert chefs.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Eggs are a perfect beginning for so many recipes and meals; Chef-host Katie Ardington is happy to "whisk" us along through a few of her favourites!

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.desc: Join our host, Chef Natalia Machado as she introduces us to her favourite techniques for using a wide variety of versatile, savoury tomatoes.

programme.title: DNA Dinners
programme.desc: Jesse Magallanes was raised in an Argentinian household, but he knows there's more to his ancestry. Host Tyrone Edwards reveals the results of his DNA test and Jesse begins his journey of self-discovery.

programme.desc: Unlock Gusto TV's top recipes on QR Countdown! Thousands of viewers scan our QR codes to access our delicious dishes. Now, we're serving up 8 of our sweetest dessert recipes, from hosts like Siobhan Detkavich and Jessica McGovern.

programme.desc: Protein-packed plant-based foods are on the One Big Recipe for chef Kimberly Lallouz's Vegetarian Dinner, five fun, filling courses designed for both vegetarians and omnivores. First up is yummy White Bean Hummus, served with pita, topped with savoury Caramelized Onion Jam and fried sage. Next is umami-packed Grilled Treviso Salad with arugula pesto, red grapes, and pine nuts. Brussels Sprouts shine in her Kimchi-inspired Korean take, topped with crunchy brown butter cashews. Salt Crusted Potato with Chive Oil will wow even the most skeptical carnivore in your orbit, and to finish, Pasta Giardina is a painting on a plate, tossing together multi-hued ribbons of garden veggies with fresh...

programme.desc: Thai chef Pailin Chongchitnant explores the cuisine of Northern Thai city Chiang Mai with red chili pork dip, minced pork salad, Thai-style chicken noodle soup, and Burmese-style curry.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: Corn is a big staple ingredient in Argentinian cuisine, and chef Natalia Machado makes tamales, corn and squash and chorizo stew, chicken in a creamy corn sauce, and then creamy corn pudding for dessert.

programme.title: One World Kitchen
programme.desc: From a trendy meatball appetizer to creamy pasta with chickpeas, decadent stuffed mussels, and succulent salmon with lavender and honey, Chef Vanessa Gianfrancesco wows again with her Italian cuisine.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: In this "C" challenge, Chef Robert Jewell cooks up recipes using coconut and crab before combining both into a single recipe. Using sweet coconut, Robert makes a classic dessert -- an irresistible coconut cream pie. He starts with a delectable crunchy graham cracker crust and tops his pie with fluffy whipped cream and toasted coconut flakes. Next, Robert transforms a fresh soft-shell crab into a delicious, spicy, and crunchy dish. The best part? It's fast and easy to make. After soaking the crab in milk, Robert dunks it into a flour-cornmeal mixture and fries it until golden brown. But that's not all, Robert whips up the perfect dipping sauce, using spicy smoked- jalapeno, lime, and...

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: It's all about sesame and scallops in this letter "S" challenge, and host Theresa Visintin has some appetizing ideas up her sleeve. First, she shows us how to make scallop cassoulet, a simple recipe that can be cooked even faster than it can eaten! Theresa browns the tender scallops in delicious bacon fat and then bakes it on a bed of creamy kidney beans. Next, Theresa uses sesame seeds to create a zesty sauce for a take-out favourite, made in your very own kitchen - noodles! For her final recipe, our culinary host combines sesame and scallops, creating a juicy, crunchy masterpiece.

programme.desc: Chefs Erica and Josh Karbelnik go head-to-head to see who can come up with the most tantalizing Sunday dinner! Josh makes roast chicken with herbs de Provence, while Erica prepares two kinds of pasta!

programme.title: Global Street Eats
programme.desc: Chef Dev prepares some of his favorite street food dishes that are easy to eat on the go, including Peruvian Ceviche, Tteokbokki from South Korea, and Manakish Flatbreads from Lebanon.

programme.title: Global Street Eats
programme.desc: Chef Dev shows off street food recipes that use less common cuts of meat, including Fish Head Curry from Singapore, Pork and Pâté Banh Mi from Vietnam, and Jamaican Jerk Oxtail.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera transforms market fresh honey, cherries, garlic scapes and carrots into two simple chic sides and an irresistible dessert.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera creates two summer fresh salads and a hearty breakfast using sprouts, potatoes and leafy lambs quarters.

programme.title: One World Kitchen Bakes the Holidays
programme.desc: Celebrate the holidays with One World Kitchen's baked treats from Italy, Japan, Thailand, and Argentina. Our hosts Vanessa, Hana, Pailin, and Natalia put a global twist on classic recipes with Panforte, honey-drizzled Struffoli, Matcha Cheesecake, Thai Shortbread Cookies, TurrÃ³n, and Pan Dulce. Our warm hosts serve up sweet treats inspired by traditions and family secrets. One World Kitchen: Bakes the Holidays will put you in the festive spirit and bring new holiday traditions to your home!

programme.title: BLITZ'N
programme.desc: Get ready for a special holiday BLITZ! with master mixologist Yvonne Langen as she prepares her favorite holiday cocktails and party snacks in the Gusto TV kitchen!

programme.title: The Wizard of Whatever: Holiday Edition
programme.desc: Gusto TV’s Wizard of Whatever, Chef Kyle Crawford, is dishing up a holiday feast! There’ll be food, fun, elves… and even jolly old St. Nick himself may make an appearance! Join in as Kyle cooks up a Christmas goose complete with stuffing and gravy, plus all the sides and salads, and even a flashy flambé dessert! Merry whatever!

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: Christmas is right around the corner and it calls for a little fun - like a twist on traditional holiday desserts! FLOUR POWER CHRISTMAS: TWISTS ON THE CLASSICS offers a new take on some of your favourites to bring you a fresh perspective and world of flavour for the holidays! Enchanting host Jessica McGovern plays off classic desserts, serving up handy hints on how to get the most out of every bite. From sweet and fluffy Gumdrop Cakes drizzled with a light lemony glaze to a delectable Eggnog Ski Slope Cake decorated with rosemary trees and a few friends to hit the hills, Jessica's unique holiday recipes will surly make it on your list of Christmas traditions!

programme.title: One World Kitchen: Our Favourite Holiday Recipes
programme.desc: In this special holiday episode of One World Kitchen, Hana (Japan), Vanessa (Italy), Natalia (Argentina), and Pailin (Thailand) get together to cook their favorite traditional holiday dishes influenced by their respective cultures. Christmas Sushi Rolls, Veal in a Creamy Tuna Sauce with Capers, Striped Bass in Garlic and Lime Marinade, and an epic Timballo. For the final recipe, our hosts combine all the flavors of One World Kitchen into a truly internationally-inspired turkey dish.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italian Christmas
programme.desc: BONACINI'S ITALIAN CHRISTMAS is a heartwarming one-hour holiday special featuring celebrity Chef Michael Bonacini as he shares some of his favourite Italian Christmas Eve dishes. Michael invites us to the set of his series "Bonacini's Italy" to cook up traditional Italian fare like Salt Cod Mousse on Polenta Crostini and Pork Braised in Milk. Michael takes us on a holiday culinary journey as he explores homey Christmas flavours and traditions, offering tips for perfecting dishes from the regions of Veneto, Sardinia, Calabria, Sicily, and Emilia Romagna.

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: The holidays are here! And the holidays come with a lineup of treats you won't be able to resist! From sweet and salty to traditional and unconventional, FLOUR POWER CHRISTMAS: BIG WOW DESSERTS covers it all. To get in the holiday spirit, enchanting host Jessica McGovern introduces two desserts that could impress any Scrooge. First, Jessica bakes a decadent Chocolate Yule Log stuffed with a creamy Salted Caramel Frosting and finishes with a holiday-inspired cake decorated with homemade peppermint candy canes! Interwoven with tricks of the trade, Jessica guides us through her simple yet inspiring treats that are perfect for a big Christmas celebration.

programme.title: Spencer's Big Holiday
programme.desc: No matter how you celebrate the holidays, let Spencer Watts help you plan the menu, in SPENCER’S BIG HOLIDAY! In this festive one-hour holiday special, Spencer Watts is serving up some of his favourite holiday meals, treats, and drinks. Follow Spencer as he shows us how to sail through the hectic holiday season with style, from brunch to the moment the clock strikes midnight.

programme.title: One BIG Holiday Recipe
programme.desc: One BIG Recipe is all about cooking for family and friends and so are the holidays! Check out cool chef Kimberly Lallouz's take on holiday favourites in this special seasonal episode. Her first course is a Moroccan spiced Beet Latke with lightly dressed greens and creme fraiche. Next, whole fennel is braised tender, gratineed and spiked with apple chutney. Entrees include a one-of-a-king Turkey Breast 'Buche de Noel' roulade and a juicy, beefy espresso-red wine spiked Brisket roast. Along with her main course come her unique, single-serving Stuffin' muffins, two sauces, sugar snap peas and watermelon radishes. And don't leave without her sweet hostess gifts, White Chocolate Brittle-Bark...

programme.title: Flour Power Holiday Specials
programme.desc: Christmas is near, and the pressure is on! Between work, home, friends, and family, the list of people to buy for is endless. To help us through this busy time, FLOUR POWER CHRISTMAS: EDIBLE GIFTS offers up four creative and more personal options to make the holidays cheaper, sweeter, and filled with love. Fun host Jessica McGovern shows us how to bake something for everyone including Crispy Brittle Bark covered in chocolate, rich Coal Cookies that are sweet with a bit of heat, adorable peanut butter-chocolate Reindeer Cupcakes, and easy-to-make Christmas Puzzle Cookies.

programme.title: Christmas With Bonacini
programme.desc: Christmas with Bonacini is a charming one-hour holiday special featuring celebrity chef Michael Bonacini and his son Oscar. Michael inspires with his favourite Christmas recipes that will add a twinkle of sophistication to your dinner table while lifting holiday spirits.

programme.title: Spencer's Holiday BBQ
programme.desc: Join charismatic chef Spencer Watts at his glorious rooftop patio for a one-hour special featuring a full holiday spread, all made on the BBQ. Spencer’s festive menu is all about creative BBQ twists with his delectable, mouth-watering recipes including Burnt Orange Cranberry Marmalade, Maple Rye Pumpkin Pie, and Asparagus with Smoked Salmon Dip. Save room for the piece de Q-sistance: Smoked Turkey Two Ways. This year, take your holiday feast outside and serve up something deliciously different.

programme.title: Michael Bonacini's Christmas at the Farm

As he explores homey Christmas flavours, Michael shares his traditions and gives tips for perfecting the holiday meal.

programme.desc: Spencer Watts serves up his take on traditional holiday fare, showing us that you can make an impressive dinner without the stress. programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.
